name: Giulia Fontana
subtitle: Programme Manager, European Customer Engagement Strategy at FedEx
about: More than 25 years of experience in marketing, loving what I do. I'm a doer, rolling up my sleeves to make a difference. I think outside the box and trying to inspire also others with new ways of thinking. I'm a solution-oriented and a real team player. I am an enthusiastic, energetic person with lots of curiosity, critical thinking and creativity. Determination, stress-management and complex problem-solving capabilities.
experiences: Programme Manager Customer Engagement Marketing Europe

As a PMO I‚Äôm connecting our CES programs with our internal stakeholders and vendors. I'm providing visibility over the workload in the portfolio and assisting in project prioritization.
Leading alignment meetings. We currently have an exciting pipeline of development and deliveries across CES and I'm the single point of contact within the CES team for these strategic initiatives. 
In addition to this new PMO role I continue to deliver my pipeline of Welcome & Activation and Promote & Delight journeys. Summary of main activities:
.Set the vision and defines the strategies for multichannel marketing incl. recommending new channels to create competitive advantage and identifies content opportunities
.Define KPIs and develop impact analyses to inform future customer journeys
.Propose strategies and tactical plans aimed at short- and long- term revenue goals
.Definition of customer journey for a product based on customer segmentation and profile
.Strong collaboration with TeleSales team to ensure a great alignment on strategy and content
.Strong collaboration with the Digital International team to optimize the customer journey execution and data gathering flow
Senior Marketing Specialist, European Lifecycle & Multichannel Strategy

Delivering best in class customer engagement marketing programs that make every FedEx experience outstanding, producing incremental revenues for the organization. 
Leading the development, tactics, and strategy of of new lifecycle journeys, value propositions and initiatives, launch and deployment of new customer engagement channels, and the optimization of existing channels to drive true multi-channel life cycle engagement and turn our customers into fans.
Senior Marketing Operations Specialist for Italy, Greece and Malta
Dir. Generale di Cernusco sul Naviglio (MI)

Management of all the go-to-market activities (offline and online), messaging and delivery to support commercial business, establishing objectives and strategies in accordance with approved plans and company policies. Create output reports that examine ROI, successes and features of lost business.
Management of the Business Plan. 
Define and coordinate of the budget, allocating to the different activities, adjusting actual spending. Strong budget management, analytical and reporting skills. 
Develop existing tactics that create a strong brand awareness and enriching customer satisfaction and loyalty: innovating and developing multiple aspects of promotional activities, including organization of international, local events and hospitalities.  
Definition and evaluation of the potential market and market segmentation by preparing surveys, scripts and monitoring of competitors‚Äô activity.
Lead Generation of new business opportunities to support the sales force and developing action plans focused on acquiring new customers. 
Communicating performance internally to both the management team and the sales department.
Train and coach two interns plus coordinating two junior marketing peers. Directly coordinate external suppliers as first line.

Achieved annual revenue targets by designing and executing highly effective marketing strategies and drove several projects with commercial perspective. Increased sales volume by applying innovative ideas related to the activities, products, and services offered by the company.

Headed overall marketing activities and campaigns for 60 branches in Italy in order to accomplish the desired competitive position of the company on the relevant markets. Restructured the institutional communication sector through keen formulation of the communication channels and identification of the optimum strategies. Strengthened relationships with external public relations and key advertising companies.

Launched an innovative product, Opti- FREE Express, for the contact-lenses solution market, as well as developed a structure in order to accomplish company‚Äôs commercial objectives. Close interaction with R&D department and Customer Service. Develop existing tactics that created a strong brand and service message.
Managed and implemented marketing plans, purchase and order forecasts.
Performing market and financial data analysis: sell-in / sell-out analysis. 
Assured the availability of all materials to support the sales force and organized various events and seminars to involve audience.
Worked with external third parties to assess partnerships and selling opportunities.
Supporting sales professionals in the field.
I reported directly to the Director of the Division.

Hired as Marketing Assistant, supporting the commercial network and then as a Junior Product Manager with the responsibility of managing the Vision Care Division product line.
Coordination of marketing activities for the products in the Italian Optical Sales Points, in line with the market requirements, outlining successful strategies. Evaluation and creation of company brand strategies, to provide feasible company objectives in line with directives and approved plans.
Assist management with the preparation of market analyses, report and manage the promotional provisions and materials; coordination with the Sales Force Network and the Division Manager.
